items.title: DeepSeek has tilted the balance towards open source AI, but big security issues remain
items.description: OpenAI Sam Altman says his company is "on the wrong side of history" with a business model built purely around proprietary AI models.

items.title: White House confirms Elon Musk is a ‘special government employee’ who could avoid publicly disclosing finances and conflicts of interest—and will only work for 130 days a year
items.description: Musk’s last two weeks have been marked by a frenzy of activity and a claim he’s been sleeping in the DOGE office.

items.title: Trump created the first ever U.S. sovereign wealth fund: Will it include Bitcoin?
items.description: Wyoming Sen. Cynthia Lummis sparked excitement by calling the move a “₿ig deal.”

items.title: Tesla and Apple are the ‘Magnificent Seven’ firms hit hardest by tariff shocks
items.description: Tesla’s stock fell 5% on Monday, the biggest drop for any member of the so-called Magnificent Seven, while Apple shares dropped 3%.

items.title: Goldman Sachs says Trump’s tariffs could bruise stocks, estimating every 5-percentage-point increase would slash S&P 500 earnings per share by 1%–2%
items.description: Before the U-turn on tariffs, Goldman Sachs said “there is a substantial probability that the tariffs on Canada and Mexico will be temporary.”
